results.title: Hand painted strip slide magic lantern with chimney
results.brief_description:
Hand painted strip slide magic lantern projector with chimney, and one set of hand painted glass slides (in restored condition).
Strip slide is a single sheet of glass with hand painting directly on to glass. Slide has a wooden frame (stable condition)
1 x Box containing projector
1 x Package containing glass slide (VERY FRAGILE)

results.title: Glass slide magic lantern
results.brief_description:
Glass slide projector as used by Department of Agriculture, Melbourne.
Lens can be compacted or extended, see attached images from ICS.
Modifications include addition of electricity and edision bulb.
1 Box containing 2 parts.

results.title: Home made 35mm Film Projector
results.brief_description:
True example of Australian ingenuity - spool arms made from bicycle pedal shanks. But it worked, and was the main component of an early days home cinema.
1 of 2: Projector
2 of 2: Box of memorabilia (4 x Cinema tickets / 1 x ‘Operation newsreel’ sticker / 1 x ‘Hoyts’ badge / 1 x ‘Last Film Search’ badge / 1 x ‘On Our Selection’ postcard / 1 x Glass slide advertisement / 1 x ‘Pathe’ small 35mm can of something / 1 x empty 35mm 50’ can of ‘Fox Movietone News’ / 1 x ‘Kodak’ roll of photographic film / 1 x ‘Build your own projector’ book / 1 x ‘Material for Radio Electrical and Mechanical’ catalogue / 1 x ‘Sun News Pictorial Hobby Book’ / 1 x ‘Liberty Theatre’ advertisment mounted on cardboard)
